TestCase.TestCaseObjective: Volumetric quantity checking incorporating OSG analysis for a nominal consumption initial use case.
TestCase.TestCaseScenario: The Producer (A) provides update information to the Consumer as prescribed utilising the P/S EM on a nominal consumption Numerous messages situation (after OSG analysis).
TestCase.TestCaseEnvironment: Internet or Co-located. Exchange Pattern: P/S.
TestCase.TestCasePreCondition: MIP4SLT1_1231.The Consumer has already achieved initialisation data and requested routine subscription to desired Topics.
TestCase.TestCaseConclusion: This test is considered a success if the Consumer successfully receives update information to which it is subscribed on a nominal consumption numerous messages situation.Check volumetric behaviour on both sides, Producer and Consumer.

TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepAction: Producer (1) processes subscription request from Consumer (2) and provides update information as prescribed utilising the Publish/Subscribe exchange mechanism, on a nominal consumption numerous messages situation (A trial exceeded found quota for ADEM R/R client has been 65,536 bytes, resulting in having to put a limit below it at the provider side. but further advice from SME would be needed).
TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepResult: Consumer (2) receives updates of subscription data, on a nominal consumption Numerous messages situation. Check and register behaviour for a quantity volumetric analysis, i.e. what happens when the Producer needs to provide numerous messages in a row, exceeding a quota limit as a result of processing a Consumer's subscription.
